p: Lu et al. (2012) found that temperature and precipitation in the growing period have important effects on the distribution of S. sphenanthera. Hu et al. (2012) found that, according to MaxEnt, Bio13 (precipitation of the wettest month), Bio18 (precipitation of the warmest quarter), and Bio1 (annual mean temperature) have important effects on the distribution of Schisandra chinensis. S. chinensis, another species in the genus. In this study, according to the contributions of individual factors to the content of schisantherin A ( Table 2), five dominant climatic factors controlled S. sphenanthera distribution. These five dominant features are Bio7 (temperature annual range), Bio16 (precipitation of the wettest quarter), Bio18 (precipitation of the warmest quarter), Bio12 (annual precipitation) and Bio1 (annual mean temperature). The weight of each of these features is higher than 6 %. Our results are therefore somewhat similar with those of Lu et al. (2012) and Hu et al. (2012).
